page.title: 06SUB AQUA CLUB
page.content: {Hamworthy Sub Aqua Club {Hamworthy Sub Aqua Club}have been diving to investigate a wreck south of the Hook sands. A shift of sand in January 1984 uncovered timbers which caught on a fisherman's net. He had to leave his net and ask divers to cut it free. Divers from the Hamworthy club were asked to uncover the wreck and the{Studland Bay Wreck Trust}was formed by {Poole Maritime Museum}and {Hamworthy Sub Aqua Club. The divers have found almost the whole side of a ship and her load of Spanish pottery called{Isabella Polychrome. It is thought that the ship was built in the{Mediterranean between 1475 {and 1525. }We do not know if the ship was bound for{Poole}or if it was driven off course by bad weather or if it was attacked by the{Studland Bay {Pirates.
